author: felicity
msg: bug 1626.  if via a new expire run, a token has an atime > current scan
count, a previous db error is likely to have been the cause.  So let's
reset the atime to the last expire time before processing.

author: felicity
msg: bug 1629: all we really care about are token updates.  since the
likelihood is that we'll be updating the same tokens multiple times,
we can save I/O by only updating the token with the final value.

author: felicity
msg: we only touch the token when syncing the journal, and the journal only has
updates from scan() whereas tokens are automatically updated from learn(),
so we will likely end up lowering the atime of the token when we sync.  doh. :(

author: quinlan
msg: tweak UNDESIRED_LANGUAGE_BODY to reduce false positives
add some additional charsets to T_MIME_BASE64_LATIN

author: quinlan
msg: a better stormpost ratware rule (works for more recent versions, I think)
